titlestmt.titleproper: Notebook with descriptions of coins from the United States and other countries, circa 1934
titlestmt.author: David Hill

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Notebook with descriptions of coins from the United States and other countries
did.abstract: Notebook of coin descriptions from an unknown creator.
did.physloc: ANS Rare Book Room - Archives Pamphlet 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Black leather, tabbed, loose-leaf notebook from an unknown creator, containing about 150 unpaginated leaves, with1934-dated calendar as first leaf. Handwritten listings are on ledger-like pages for an unidentified coin collection. Some of the thirteen tabs include the following categories: American colonial, U.S. large cents and half cents, Great Britain, foreign silver, curious money, ancient gold, and U.S. gold. Most of the listings identify the coin by date, grade/condition, and a third, unidentifiable characteristic. Contained in a pocket in the back cover are two loose, folded documents pertaining to coins.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.
